definitions: short light oar used in pairs for rowing a boat
narrow racing boat propelled by one or more rowers using sculls
examples: She gripped the scull tightly as she rowed across the lake
The wooden scull broke when it hit the rocks
The team practiced in their new scull every morning
His single scull glided smoothly through the calm water

definitions: method of rowing using two oars moved simultaneously by one person
examples: She spent years perfecting her sculling technique for competitions
Sculling requires excellent coordination between both arms

definitions: person who creates three-dimensional artworks by carving, molding, or shaping materials
examples: The sculptor worked tirelessly on the marble statue
She became a renowned sculptor after years of practice

definitions: layer of dirt or foam floating on liquid surface
offensive term for people considered worthless or contemptible
examples: Green scum covered the stagnant pond water
She skimmed the scum off the boiling soup
The detective called the criminals scum of society
He treated his employees like scum, which was unacceptable

definitions: rapid hurried movement with short quick steps
examples: We heard the scurry of mice in the attic
There was a sudden scurry of activity when the boss arrived

definitions: disease caused by lack of vitamin C characterized by bleeding gums and weakness
examples: Sailors often suffered from scurvy on long ocean voyages
Fresh citrus fruits helped prevent scurvy among the crew

definitions: metal container for storing coal near a fireplace
small opening or hatch in a ship's deck or hull
hurried run with short quick steps
examples: She filled the scuttle with coal for the evening fire
The old brass scuttle sat beside the fireplace
The sailor opened the scuttle to access the storage area
Water poured through the damaged scuttle during the storm
The crab's sideways scuttle across the sand amused the children
We heard the scuttle of feet on the stairs

definitions: agricultural tool with long curved blade on wooden handle for cutting grass or grain
examples: The farmer sharpened his scythe before harvesting the wheat
Death is often depicted carrying a scythe in artwork

definitions: bottom surface of the sea or ocean
examples: Divers explored the seabed searching for ancient shipwrecks
Strange creatures live on the deep seabed

definitions: bird that lives primarily near or on the ocean
examples: Seabirds circled above the fishing boats looking for food
The rocky cliffs provided nesting sites for many seabirds

definitions: land area along the edge of the sea or ocean
examples: Major cities developed along the eastern seaboard
The storm affected communities throughout the Atlantic seaboard

definitions: land along the edge where it meets the sea
examples: They built their summer home near the seacoast
The rugged seacoast attracted many tourists each year

definitions: person who travels or works on the sea especially as a sailor
examples: The old seafarer told stories of distant lands
Many seafarers spend months away from their families

definitions: work or activity of traveling by sea as an occupation or way of life
examples: His family had a long tradition of seafaring
Seafaring was dangerous work in the age of sail

definitions: fish and shellfish from the sea used as food
examples: The restaurant specialized in fresh local seafood
She was allergic to most types of seafood

definitions: part of a town facing the sea with buildings and promenade
examples: Hotels lined the seafront offering ocean views
They strolled along the seafront enjoying the sunset

definitions: common gray and white bird found near seas and coasts
examples: Seagulls swooped down to steal food from picnickers
The cry of seagulls filled the morning air

definitions: small marine fish with horse-like head that swims upright
examples: The seahorse wrapped its tail around the coral
Male seahorses carry eggs in their pouch

definitions: material used to seal gaps or joints making them watertight or airtight
examples: Apply sealant around the bathtub to prevent leaks
The window needed new sealant to stop drafts

definitions: protective coating applied to surfaces to seal or preserve them
person who hunts seals for their fur or oil
examples: The deck needs a coat of sealer before winter
This wood sealer protects against moisture damage
The sealer returned from the Arctic with pelts
Many sealers worked in dangerous conditions

definitions: process of closing or making something airtight or watertight
practice of hunting seals commercially
examples: Proper sealing prevents heat loss through windows
The sealing of the jar keeps food fresh longer
Sealing was once a major industry in some regions
Environmental groups protested against commercial sealing

definitions: line where two pieces of fabric are sewn together
layer of coal or mineral ore between rock layers
examples: She carefully pressed the seam flat after sewing
The seam split when he bent down
Miners discovered a rich coal seam underground
The geological survey revealed several gold seams

definitions: person who works on a ship especially as member of crew
examples: The experienced seaman knew how to read weather patterns
Every seaman aboard helped during the emergency

definitions: skill and knowledge needed to operate and navigate ships safely
examples: Good seamanship prevented disaster during the storm
The captain's seamanship earned respect from the crew

definitions: mountain rising from ocean floor that does not reach the surface
examples: The seamount provided habitat for diverse marine life
Sonar revealed a massive seamount beneath the ship

definitions: aircraft designed to take off and land on water
examples: The seaplane landed smoothly on the calm lake
Remote islands were accessible only by seaplane

definitions: town or city with a harbor where ships load and unload
examples: The busy seaport handled cargo from around the world
Many historic seaports became major commercial centers

definitions: someone who looks carefully for something or someone
examples: The searcher combed through archives for historical documents
Volunteer searchers helped locate the missing hiker

definitions: powerful lamp producing a concentrated beam that can be directed
examples: The searchlight swept across the night sky
Prison guards used searchlights to monitor the perimeter

definitions: painting or photograph showing a view of the sea
examples: The artist specialized in dramatic seascapes
Her collection included seascapes from various coastal regions

definitions: hard protective outer case of sea creatures like mollusks
examples: Children collected colorful seashells along the beach
She held the seashell to her ear

definitions: land along the edge of sea or ocean including beach
examples: They spent the afternoon exploring the rocky seashore
Many creatures live in pools along the seashore

definitions: area or town next to the sea especially for vacations
examples: The family rented a cottage at the seaside
Traditional seaside resorts offered entertainment and beaches

definitions: relating to or happening during particular seasons of the year
examples: Stores hired seasonal workers for the holiday rush
Seasonal allergies affected her every spring

definitions: salt, herbs, or spices added to food to enhance flavor
examples: She added seasoning to the soup before serving
The chef created a special seasoning blend

definitions: strap designed to hold person securely in vehicle seat for safety
examples: Always fasten your seatbelt before the car moves
The seatbelt saved her life in the accident

definitions: arrangement or provision of places to sit in venue or vehicle
examples: The theater offered comfortable seating for 500 people
We need to finalize the seating chart for the wedding

definitions: wall built along shore to prevent erosion and flooding from waves
examples: The concrete seawall protected homes from storm surges
Workers repaired the damaged section of the seawall

definitions: direction or position toward the sea from land
examples: The house faced seaward with stunning ocean views
Birds flew seaward as the storm approached inland

definitions: salty water from the sea or ocean
examples: Seawater corroded the metal fixtures over time
The aquarium used filtered seawater for marine exhibits

definitions: navigable route for ships through water connecting different areas
examples: The seaway allowed cargo ships to reach inland ports
Ice blocked the northern seaway during winter months

definitions: plant-like organisms growing in sea or on rocks at shore
examples: Seaweed washed up on the beach after the storm
Many Asian cuisines use dried seaweed in cooking

definitions: informal shortened form of second meaning very brief time
examples: Wait just a sec while I grab my coat
I'll be there in a sec after this call

definitions: act of formally withdrawing from membership of political union or organization
examples: The state's secession from the union sparked civil war
Several members threatened secession from the trade organization

definitions: person who supports or advocates secession from a political union
examples: Secessionist movements gained support in the region
The government arrested several prominent secessionists

definitions: state of being private and away from other people or activities
examples: The writer sought seclusion to finish her novel
They enjoyed the seclusion of their mountain cabin
